en: Lord, thou hast been our dwelling-place In all generations.
hmr: LALPA nang chu suon po po chena kan umna i ni hlak,

en: Before the mountains were brought forth, Or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world, Even from everlasting to everlasting, thou art God.
hmr: Tlânghai insieng hmaha, Leihnuoi le khawvêl în ngîr hma khawm khan, Chatuona inthawka chatuon chenin nang chu Pathien i nih.

en: Thou turnest man to destruction, And sayest, Return, ye children of men.
hmr: Nang chun mihriem hi bohmangnaa în fetir hlak a, “Mihriem nauhai, kîr nâwk ro,” i ti hlak.

en: For a thousand years in thy sight Are but as yesterday when it is past, And as a watch in the night.
hmr: Nanga ngai chun kum sâng khat hi, Zâni bo ta ang chau kha a na, Zân vêng khat sûng ang chau bawk a nih.

en: Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep: In the morning they are like grass which groweth up.
hmr: Anni chu tui lien angin i lên hmang hlak a, ṭhang khat in ang chau an nih. Zîngkâr chun hlobet inder suok ang an nih.

en: In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up; In the evening it is cut down, and withereth.
hmr: Zîngkâr chun a hung innoin a hung inder suok a, Zântieng chun ât thlûkin a um a, a vuoi hlak.

en: For we are consumed in thine anger, And in thy wrath are we troubled.
hmr: I lunginsennaa sukbohmangin kan um a, I lungawi nawnaa suklungzîngin kan um bawk sih a.

en: Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, Our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.
hmr: Kan rîtlonahai chu i hmaah i sieh a, Kan suol iprûkhai chu i hmêl varah i sie tah a.

en: For all our days are passed away in thy wrath: We bring our years to an end as a sigh.
hmr: Kan dam sûng ni po po hi i lunginsennaah a bo hlak, Kan dam sûng kumhai hi tienami angin kan suktâwp hlak.

en: The days of our years are threescore years and ten, Or even by reason of strength fourscore years; Yet is their pride but labor and sorrow; For it is soon gone, and we fly away.
hmr: Kan dam sûng kumhai chu kum sâwmsari a na, Hrâtna leiin kum sâwmriet khawm a ni thei. Nisienlakhawm, a sâwtna chu sininrimna le lungngaina chau a nih; A bo vak a, keini khawm kan vuong hmang hlak a ni hi.

en: Who knoweth the power of thine anger, And thy wrath according to the fear that is due unto thee?
hmr: Tuin am i lunginsenna thilthawtheizie hreha, Nangma ṭi dingzie anga i lunginsenna hrie le?

en: So teach us to number our days, That we may get us a heart of wisdom.
hmr: Kan dam sûng nihai tiem dân ding mîn chûktir la, Varna lungril kan nei pha hielna dingin.

en: Return, O Jehovah; how long? And let it repent thee concerning thy servants.
hmr: Aw LALPA hung kîr nâwk la, ieng chen am i lunginsen ding a na? I siehlawhai chungthua chun i lungril inlêt rawh.

en: Oh satisfy us in the morning with thy lovingkindness, That we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
hmr: Aw, zîngkâr chun i ngilneinain mi suktlai la, Kan dam sûng po po hin kan hlima kan lâwm theina dingin.

en: Make us glad according to the days wherein thou hast afflicted us, And the years wherein we have seen evil.
hmr: Nangin i mi sukrimsik ni le, Thil ṭha naw kan tuok kum sûng hu ang khan mi suklâwm rawh.

en: Let thy work appear unto thy servants, And thy glory upon their children.
hmr: I sinthaw chu i siehlawhai kuomah inlang sienla, I ropuina chu an nauhai kuomah inlang raw se.

en: And let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us; And establish thou the work of our hands upon us; Yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.
hmr: Chun, LALPA kan Pathien mawina chu kan chungah um raw se: Kan kut sinthaw hi kan chungah sukdet bawk la, Anih, kan kut sinthaw hi sukdet rawh.
